responsibilities: Develop a deep learning compiler stack that converts neural network descriptions into code for special-purpose and embedded platforms.
Use modern compiler frameworks such as LLVM and MLIR.
Develop optimized implementations of neural-network operations and integrate them into a runtime framework.
Develop new optimization techniques and algorithms to efficiently map CNNs onto Xtensa processors and specialized hardware.
Benchmark end-to-end network performance on DSP and special-purpose accelerator platforms.
Enhance the framework to improve functionality and performance on various hardware platforms.
Devise multiprocessor/multicore partitioning and scheduling strategies.
Develop complex programs to validate the functionality and performance of the CNN application programming kit.
Work with hardware designers to identify opportunities for additional hardware acceleration of neural network functions.
Collaborate with industry-leading partners and customers to design and standardize neural network APIs.
qualifications: Expertise in C and C++ programming.
Experience in software development on Linux and Windows systems, including testing, debugging, and releasing.
Knowledge of state-of-the-art compiler stacks such as LLVM and MLIR.
Experience with compilation techniques like loop optimization, polyhedral models, and IR construction/transition/lowering techniques.
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Caffe, and PyTorch.
Experience programming and optimizing for embedded platforms such as DSPs with DMA engines.
Familiarity with deep learning compilation approaches like Glow, TVM, and XLA.
Knowledge of neural net exchange formats like ONNX and NNEF.
analysis:
The job responsibilities and skills focus on developing a deep learning compiler stack, optimizing neural network operations, and working with specialized hardware platforms. The responsibilities include tasks such as developing optimization techniques for CNNs, benchmarking network performance, and collaborating on neural network APIs. The skills required include expertise in C and C++ programming, knowledge of compiler stacks like LLVM and MLIR, and familiarity with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Caffe, and PyTorch.

While the job involves working with neural networks and deep learning frameworks, there is no specific mention of Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The focus is more on the compilation and optimization of neural networks for embedded platforms rather than on generating content or processing natural language, which are typical applications of GenAI and LLMs.

Therefore, based on the provided responsibilities and skills, the job does not explicitly involve working with Generative AI or language models.
